TLDR: Stay far FAR away from this game. It's crappy now, there hasn't been new content since 2017, and you will never get a chance to experience it the way it was in its original vision anyway.

Full review (sorry for length, but this one is personal): 

As someone who bought this game at launch, and has probably over 1000 hours on this, I have a lot to say about this game, and just how far it has fallen.

It was great at launch, especially if you were looking for a casual, fun, fast-paced, unexpected, tumultous, chaotic, and at times just straight up insane multiplayer experience in the tradition of TF2. You could meet new gaming buddies and hang out and it was just an insanely fun time. The initial 16 heroes and their unique abilities plus the absence of any hero or role limits per team (especially in quick play) offered lots of potential to think of new creative ways to beat the enemy team, and causing matches to stay fast paced throughout by forcing each team to adjust team strategy and team composition accordingly.

Then for whatever reason they decided that, akshually, this game needs to be a super serious E-sport and basically reworked a bunch of heroes, implemented hero limits in every mode, including quick play, and just in general seemed to consider the opinions of their League players and the competitive crowd above the opinions of the average, casual player who was just trying to have a good time with their friends.

Imagine someone looking at Team Fortress 2 and saying: "This game is good, but it could be much better if it was less chaotic and had its own competitive scene!"

You would think that this person is absolutely out of their mind. 
And yet, this is what they did to Overwatch.

These changes came subtly, at first anyway, yet insidiously changing the game's very nature and the kind of gamer it attracts.
This is when Overwatch died for me personally, about 2 years after its release.

I still kept going back for about a year or so because I wasn't ready to let go of the game i once knew or, rather, the memories and friends that I made, but ultimately I just couldn't even look at it anymore, and what it had become.
And thank god i got out when I did, because it was only downhill from here.
They catered the game even more to the competitive crowd , limiting gameplay possibilites even more by the implementation of role limits, and tried really really hard to force the League to really become the next big thing, even though Overwatch just absolutely isn't the kind of game to do that with, the same way you wouldn't do that kind of thing with Team Fortress 2.

And then came the announcement of Overwatch 2.

So Overwatch 2 originally started out as a meme, a JOKE. A joke that, for whatever reason, Blizzard looked at and thought: "Actually yes what a brilliant idea!"

And well, we all know where it all led to.

Hero's locked behind a battle pass, overpriced missions that is just archives, and bizzard making false promises, and all the dlc is bad. If you want to spend money on this game buy the battle pass.

Dude I heckin HATE cosmetic microtransactions, them making the game free2play when you had to buy it before, being forced to play for a while to be able to unlock everything, developers ignoring what the players want and not delivering on their promises.. but enough about TF2

Friend bought the original Overwatch for me for about 30 bucks in 2017. I've played hundreds of hours and never spent a dime. The monetization has gotten somehow gotten WORSE with the removal of loot boxes, but it hasn't affected my enjoyment of the game yet. I know newer players have it worse due to the hero unlocks, so I can't speak to that. Overall, it's a great friend group activity. I'll stop playing when I stop having fun.
